item.title: Nordic aliens
item.description:
Nordic Aliens ðŸ”—

In ufology, “Nordics,” “Nordic aliens,” or “Tall Whites” are terms used to describe alleged humanoid extraterrestrials who purportedly resemble Nordic, Germanic, or Scandinavian humans. They are said to originate from the Pleiades star cluster and are often described by contactees as being taller than average humans (6-7 ft), with blond hair, blue eyes, and fair skin. Some reports also mention pale-blue/grey or pastel purple skin tones.

History ðŸ”—

Early stories of Nordic aliens may have been inspired by the 1951 film The Day the Earth Stood Still. Within the ufology community, these aliens are often associated with spiritual growth, benevolence, and protection. They are described as concerned about Earth’s ecology and world peace, possessing telepathic abilities, and exhibiting paternal, watchful, affectionate, and youthful characteristics. While popular in the 1950s, claims of encounters with Nordic aliens have become less frequent, with the grey alien becoming more prominent in reported extraterrestrial encounters. David J. Skal, a cultural historian, and Stephanie Kelley-Romano, a professor at Bates College, are mentioned in relation to their perspectives on Nordic aliens.

Publications by Those Claiming to Have Been Contacted ðŸ”—

Several books detail alleged personal contact with Nordic aliens. These include Flying Saucers Have Landed and Inside the Space Ships by George Adamski, From Outer Space to You by Howard Menger, The Walton Experience by Travis Walton, and Millennial Hospitality by Charles James Hall, which was adapted into the film Walking with the Tall Whites. The UFO religion Universe People also publishes interactions with “Cosmic Friends.”
